data.title: Facebook Is Being Distracted by Political Ads, Analyst Debra Aho Williamson Says
data.text: EMarketer Principal Analyst Debra Aho Williamson and Estimize Inc. Chief Executive Officer Leigh Drogen discuss Facebook Inc.'s third-quarter earnings. They speak with Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Jim Cramer: Investors must consider these two critical factors affecting Facebook and Apple
data.text: "I'm sensing some skepticism ... creeping in about both of them and I suspect some of it has to do with twin constraints of time and government," CNBC's Jim Cramer says.

data.title: MarketWatch First Take: Zuckerberg stands defiant on political ads, swinging ‘free expression’ at critics like a hammer
data.text: Facebook Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg came out swinging in the company’s earnings call Wednesday, defending his stance on allowing political advertisements on the world’s largest social network in a continuing strategy change from a defensive stance to an assault on naysayers.

data.title: Facebook's CEO adamantly supports the decision to keep running the ads on its platform
data.text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg used a call typically reserved for detailing financial results to defend the company's decision to keep running political ads on its platform.

data.title: Political controversies overshadow Facebook's strong financial report
data.text: Facebook’s myriad political controversies overshadowed a strong financial quarter on Wednesday as the chief executive, Mark Zuckerberg, delivered an impassioned defense of his company on a conference call with investors.

data.title: Mark Zuckerberg is adamant that Instagram should not be broken off from Facebook
data.text: Facebook's CEO said during Wednesday's earnings call that even with Instagram, the company faces stiff competition.

data.title: Facebook’s Earnings and Revenue Jump, Topping Forecasts
data.text: The company’s financial performance is a regular bright spot for the social giant, which has been embroiled in scandals in recent years.

data.title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg defends himself against Twitter's Jack Dorsey on political ads
data.text: Facebook's approach came under intense scrutiny this month after the company said it would allow Trump's re-election campaign to run an ad with false claims about former Vice President Joe Biden and his son.

data.title: Facebook Removes More Russian Accounts, Sees Shares Rise On Q3 Sales Upswing
data.text: Facebook stock gained ground in after-hours trading following the company’s release of stronger-than expected third-quarter results. It was another newsy day for a company seldom out of the headlines. Earlier Wednesday, it announced it had removed dozens of accounts linked to ill-intentioned forces based in Russia. In the quarter, Facebook reported total income of $2.12

data.title: Facebook's Revenue Growth Accelerates (Again)
data.text: Once again, management is wrong -- but in a good way. The company's top-line growth continued to accelerate, even as management forecast it would decelerate.

data.title: Zuckerberg defends political ads that will be 0.5% of 2020 revenue
data.text: As Jack Dorsey announced his company Twitter would drop all political ads, Facebook CEO Zuckerberg doubled-down on his policy of refusing to fact check politicians’ ads. “At times of social tension there has often been an urge to pull back on free expression.

data.title: Facebook (FB) Q3 Earnings and Revenues Beat Estimates
data.text: Facebook (FB) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 10.99% and 1.90%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2019. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

data.title: Zuckerberg's odds in antitrust battle may be even better than Facebook earnings
data.text: Facebook's former privacy chief Chris Kelly says if Elizabeth Warren thinks she can break up Facebook, "good luck" to her. Mark Zuckerberg's legal odds are high, in Kelly's opinion, but antitrust law experts are not so sure.

data.title: Facebook’s mixed Q3 sees users grow 2% to 2.45B
data.text: A massive penalty hangs over Facebook’s  head, but it otherwise had a very strong Q1 earnings report. data.title: Facebook set to report third-quarter earnings after the bell

data.title: Facebook shares rise 4% after earnings beat estimates
data.text: Shares of Facebook Inc. jumped 4% in after-hours trading Wednesday after the company announced third-quarter results that soundly beat analysts’ earnings estimates and topped revenue forecasts.

data.title: Facebook returns to profit growth as ad revenues surge
data.text: Facebook returned to profit growth in its third quarter as a surge in advertising revenue boosted its bottom line.

data.title: Facebook agrees to pay UK data watchdog’s Cambridge Analytica fine but settles without admitting liability
data.text: Facebook has reached a settlement with the UK’s data protection watchdog, the ICO, agreeing to pay in full a £500,000 (~$643k) fine following the latter’s investigating into the Cambridge Analytica data misuse scandal. As part of the arrangement Facebook has agreed to drop its legal appeal against the penalty.

data.title: Facebook agrees to pay UK fine over Cambridge Analytica scandal
data.text: Facebook has agreed to pay a 500,000 pound ($644,000) fine for breaches of data protection law related to the harvesting of data by consultancy Cambridge Analytica, Britain's information rights regulator said on Wednesday.

data.title: WhatsApp sues Israeli company over cyberattack that it says targeted journalists, dissidents and diplomats
data.text: WhatsApp is suing an Israeli company that it claims was behind a cyberattack that installed spyware on users' phones and targeted human rights defenders, journalists, political dissidents, diplomats and government officials.

data.title: Media mogul Barry Diller: Zuckerberg is right not to censor political ads
data.text: Barry Diller, former chief of Fox and Paramount Pictures and now chairman of IAC, joins "Squawk Box" to give his thoughts on the controversy of Facebook's political advertising policies.
